description: See Creole. Attested in English to refer to language from the 18th century.

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A language formed from two or more languages which has developed from a pidgin to become a first language.
Alternative letter-case form of Creole (“person born in a colony”)
a style of hoop earrings that comprise of a hoop that has an inconsistent thickness and/or is elongated in shape
